summary: The caracal is a medium-sized wild cat found in Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It has a reddish-tan coat, long tufted ears, and can leap very high. Caracals are mainly nocturnal and live alone or in pairs. They eat birds and small mammals, hunting by stalking and chasing their prey. They can have up to six kittens at a time and live about 16 years in captivity.
title: Caracal
